analyzed: gaṅgā kumudinī santā  saṅkhavaṇṇā ca kokilā
translated: The Ganges is white lotuses, 🔽the cuckoos are the color of conch shells,
When the turtle and the pigeon 🔽have a three-fold cloak,
When the legs of the crab
When the horns of the hare

analyzed: yadā nisseṇim āruyha  candam khādeyyu mūsikā
translated: When, having ascended that, 🔽the mice would eat the moon,
and the rats would devour Rāhu—

analyzed: yadā surā ghaṭam pitvā  makkhikā gaṇa cāriṇī
translated: When, having drunk a pot of liquor, 🔽the flies that wander in groups
would make their dwelling in embers—

original: atha nūna tadā siyā.🔽Yadā bimboṭṭhasampanno,🔽gadrabho sumukho siyā;
analyzed: atha nūna tadā siyā  yadā bimboṭṭha sampannaḥ  gadrabhaḥ su mukhaḥ siyā
translated: then perhaps that could be. 🔽When the donkey is well-formed, 🔽with a good face,
They would consult together in private,

original: atha nūna tadā siyā.🔽Yadā muḷāla pattānaṁ,
analyzed: atha nūna tadā siyā  yadā muḷāla pattāna
translated: Then indeed it would be so.🔽When a parasol would be more firm
Than the leaves of the Muḷāla tree,
Then indeed it would be so.
When a bird of the Kulaka species🔽Would carry off the Gandhamādana mountain

original: atha nūna tadā siyā.🔽Yadā sāmuddikaṁ nāvaṁ,🔽sayantaṁ savaṭākaraṁ;
analyzed: atha nūna tadā siyā  yadā sāmuddikam  sayantam sa vaṭākara
translated: Then indeed it would be so.
When a slave would carry off🔽A ship from the ocean, with all its cargo,
Then indeed it would be so.”
The Birth Story of Aṭṭhānajātaka (Jā 9) is the ninth.
